headline: Best Green Bean Casserole
description: This green bean casserole pairs tender green beans with crunchy French-fried onions in creamy cheese sauce. A family-favorite recipe for the holidays!

video.description: A shortcut recipe for green bean casserole you'll want to have.
video.name: Best Green Bean Casserole

name: Best Green Bean Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix green beans and condensed soup together in a large microwave-safe bowl until well combined. Microwave on high until warm, 3 to 5 minutes.
Stir 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese into the green bean mixture. Microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes.
Transfer mixture to a casserole dish and spread evenly over the bottom. Sprinkle French-fried onions over top, then sprinkle with remaining Cheddar.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and the onions are just turning brown, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I tripled the recipe and only used about a cup of cheese inside and omitted adding to the top so the onions wouldn’t get goopy. I added some cracked pepper too. It was a hit and so easy. I may try to test this with fresh green beans, but ultimately, this is a winner and I will most definitely make again!
This was delicious! I just need to double it next time!
Easiest and best Green Bean Casserole ever, according to my family. I do add bacon bits to it though too.
Added bacon, sauteed onion and minced garlic.
We really liked this green bean casserole. So easy to make. We added bacon and mushrooms which gave the casserole a good flavor. I added cooked bacon and mushrooms before baking.

I used smoked gouda cheese and added real bacon bits to give the whole dish a smokey flavor. Turned out great. The only thing I experienced that left me a bit disappointed was the longer it sat in the baking dish after cooling, the more water appeared. As though the cream of mushroom soup just turned to water.

AWESOME! Truly the best green bean casserole ever. Followed the recipe exactly save for sprinkling on the second 1/2 c of cheese and THEN onions (so they'd stay crispy). Everyone went back for seconds. We're making this again for Christmas, if not sooner!
I add a teaspoon of garlic powder and a 1/2 teaspoon of onion powder to the dish! Perfect every time!
very easy and good! family loves this dish

Based on the comments, I added bacon bits. I mixed the cheese into the mixture so just the onions went on top. I find "traditional" string bean casseroles bland. This one had flavor. My family was used to the "traditional" one and were a little thrown by this recipe, but they ended up loving it. I will make this one again, with the bacon bits.
This was a solid base. I did add sauted mushrooms, shallot and 6 peices of bacon (crumbled). I will make again.
I simply love it and so does my family we will make this Thanksgiving Christmas any holidays that we want to use it for our green bean casserole forever now it is the best hats off to the chef
I have made this for years and years, made again today but added some crispy bacon and put all the cheese in with the beans. Very good!
The family loves this recipe. I don't put the cheese on top with the onions. The cheese makes the onion topping weird/less crisp. The cheese mixed in the casserole is delish!!
The cheese made it extra good. A great addition to my Easter dinner.
I have made this a few times and it is so good with the cheese and this time I added black olives
I prefer to use low sodium stove top. The fried onions were a little too salty for me. But overall simple and tasty.

This recipe is Not the Best Ever.
Bland, flavorless, basic.

This is a fantastic, easy recipe. I did make some additions, however. I added some bacon, garlic powder, & extra cheese to it! I made it for my family on Thanksgiving, without the garlic, & everyone loved it so much I was asked to make it again for our Christmas Dinner! We'll see how they like the new modification!

This was so easy to make and everyone loved it! I added some of the French fried onions to the mixture as well as putting them on top. I used French-style green beans instead of whole, cut green beans. I also doubled the recipe. I noticed a comment about finding it runny. Make sure to drain the water from the cans of green beans before putting them in the bowl.
My family always loves this recipe and asks for it My one big change is I use cream of chicken instead of mushroom I have one in the oven now
Did everything the same
Amazing! It's so Delicious.
I make my casserole with fresh green beans and homemade onion rings. Just use 1 8oz pack of beans and cook 45 minutes
We love this recipe...I always add slivered almonds ...never any leftovers.
Great recipe! Quick simple and easy. Taste great.
Good. Add some milk to soup and whisk together with cheese before mixing with beans
better then grandmas lol

I made some changes to this, based on what other reviewers said. I used fresh green beans, microwaved for 5-7 minutes until still crisp, and left to the side while I prepped the mixture. I used mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, and french fried onions. I also added 2-3 tablespoons of sour cream, real bacon pieces, salt, pepper, garlic/onion powders and little cayenne pepper for a slight kick. After mixture was to my liking, I folded in the green beans and baked in oven for 30-35 minutes. About 5 minutes before done, I added a layer of french fried onion on top (used all cheddar in the mixture) and heated until topping was warm. Absolutely delicious!

I made this for Thanksgiving in 2021. I doubled it and didn't make any changes in the ingredients. The only "change" I made was to the preparation and cooking. 

I didn't cook anything in the microwave. Instead, I mixed the green beans, mushroom soup, ALL the cheese and half the fried onions together in a casserole dish. Baked it for 35 mins, then topped with the remaining fried onions and baked an additional 5 mins. It was wonderful!

I'll be using this recipe again for sure. Thanks!

I absolutely loved it and was easy to make. Instead of microwaving because I didn't have a big enough bowl, I cooked green beans, soup, and added 1/4 cup of milk on stove top over medium heat for 5 minutes. Added 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese and cooked another 3-5 minutes until cheese was melted. Then continued to make as directions indicated! It was delicious!
The cheese added a bit more flavor to a tired old dish. Next time I'm thinking a unique cheddar with a bit more character is in order.

Made for Thanksgiving 2021. Was delicious! However, added a couple splashes of soy sauce and salt. Used canned French cut beans. Mixed all the cheese in the mix and only topped with half the onions on top. The other half was also mixed in with the other ingredients.
Loved it. I skipped the microwave, put all cheese into mixture, baked for 35min
Amazing! I love it!
The best green bean casserole ever! Thank you!!
Was simple and everyone liked it, I added more salt & pepper to the mushroom bowl & used cut french beans & onion crisps , topped with onions no cheese on top.
This is the recipe I use ! It's always a great addition to any meal. Family loves it
yes, love it! Thank you! Always a hit!
grn berns

I did not like this version of green bean casserole. The cheese in the green beans is fine, but there is no other flavor. I missed having some of the onions mixed in. I didn't like putting all those onions just on the top. The recipe reads that you should put the onions on first and top with the cheese. It all had a weird texture when it was done. I won't be making this version again.
This is so delicious! I have made it many times and perfectly tasty every time! It’s not just for the Holidays! Goes great with a Mississippi pot roast as a side dish!

I followed suggestion of a few others and bypassed the microwave and just poured everything into baking dish (reserving 1/4 C 
 cheese and french fried onions). I also mixed in 1/2 tsp soy sauce. Then baked 20 min. Sprinkled the french fried onions & the other 1/4 C cheese & baked 7-8 min. NOTE: THICK shredded cheese melts better.
Super easy and tastes better then the ones that take longer.
I added a can of spinach and chopped mushrooms.
My family loved it. It was quick, easy and absolutely delicious!!! From now on, this is the green bean casserole I am making!!! Great recipe, thanks for sharing!!!

My other half is a Green Bean Casserole snob and he has asked that I make this dish on a regular basis and no other. So big win!
I also added chicken and sliced potatoes (both canned, sports really take up time to cook somedays) and it was dang good. Thank you for this!

This recipe was great and everyone loved it. I mixed everything together in a casserole dish, except the fried onions. I heated in a 350 oven for 20 minutes, then added the fried onions on top and baked another 10 minutes. This is the recipe I’ll use from now on.

Delicious and easy to make, but there was no clarification for the size of the casserole dish. I would recommend something smaller than a 9x13, as that's what I used, and it came out different than I was expecting. Otherwise, 10/10.
Good. Easy. I sauteed onions in olive oil and garlic until soft and then added them to the casserole before baking. I think this would be even better with fresh green beans.

Made an account just to say this is one of the most delicious things i’ve ever tasted in my life, swear i’ve made this 6-8 times in the last month

Might try crumbling turkey bacon and throwing the bits on top with the cheese and french fried onions

Use fresh french style green beans and be sure to trim the tips and halve them. I mixed everything together and put it right in the over, no microwaving. I also added some cooked bacon bits to the main mixture with the cheese.
This was great! The whole family loved it!
The whole family loved it!

We have made this twice this year, we love it! I mixed all the cheese, green beans, and soup together and baked for 20-30 minutes. I then put all the fried onions on top and bake another 5-12. I skip the microwaving, and mix all the cheese in together and it's so good! Pretty salty but we like it that way.
I served it for Christmas dinner. All my family and guests loved it!
Delicious! Love the cheese!

This is my favorite recipe for green beans BUT I change it. Fresh green beans cooked first, then I mix/heat the soup and cheese with perhaps a little milk or water, not much to make it creamy. Mix the green beans with soup/cheese mixture and put in casserole dish. Topping same as recipe.
Who doesn't love cheese? And who doesn't love green bean casserole? Put them together...and OMG! Heaven!
yummy classic
Made it for Thanksgiving. Loved by all. Making it again already, just because it's delicious.

I live in the Netherlands, and every year our Dutch friends look forward to the green bean casserole. In fact, they rave about it all year long. They always ask to make sure it's going to be part of the meal. This recipe is so simple, takes only minutes, and is a hit with the guests.

This is my favorite Green Bean Casserole Recipe and I did the same changes as the 1st Review I read. I mixed all of the cheese and half of the fried onions with the green beans and mushroom soup. I also added 1 can of chopped water chestnuts. I also used the French cut green beans. I will make this often!

This is so good. I had my doubts because I have been making the original recipe for 20 years but this is just yummy. Mixed 1/2 the onions and all the cheese with everything else, baked 30 mins, added the rest of the onions with 5 mins left. Thanks for the recipe.
Quick! Easy! Delicious!
It was so simple and everyone raved about it. It must of been good, no left overs. It’s a keeper.

This recipe was my first attempt at a green bean casserole and it came out really pretty good! Thanks for sharing this.. I did add about 6 fresh chopped White mushrooms and some cooked bacon into it and it made it tastier I thought.

Great recipe. I used Mushroom soup with roasted garlic, french style green beans and reduced the cheese to 1/2 cup, and mixed it into the mixture. Don't add salt and pepper. Less is better with this recipe as the onions and beans contain salt.

I should've known better than to mess with perfection. This time, I was persuaded by all of the positive reviews. Personally, I did not like this at all with the cheese added. My husband is a cheese lover, and he agreed that it is better without. Live and learn...
Left out the onions because I forgot to pick some up...but this was yummy cheesy goodness even without! I did sprinkle some crushed corn flakes on top for crispiness which were a nice touch.
Wonderful! Very tasty.
This worked out really well. I will definitely make it again.
good with chopped water chestnuts
very good and easy recipe
It turned out AMAZING!!!!!
I used the base of this recipe but I changed it a bit. I did frozen steamed string beans, real bacon, baby bella mushrooms. It’s so good!
i loved it it was so delicious
Very simple, I used fresh green beans so I boiled and added course salt and pepper.

The dish was a major hit!! I made it for Friendsgiving and everyone absolutely devoured it! I’m giving this 4 stars because I had to make adjustments to the recipe. Followed other reviews and used French cut green beans, mixed all the ingredients (beans, soup, ALL of cheese, and half of the onions) and baked for 30 mins. Then I took the casserole dish out of the oven and put the rest of the fried onions on top and baked for another 10 mins. Skipped the microwave step.

I've been making this variation of the green bean casserole for years! the cheese makes all the difference and I add it all to the mix. I also substitute golden mushroom soup, I like it better and it gives the dish a savory flavor. also, if you like garlic, try crispy fried garlic on top instead of the onions, a whole new flavor, I promise you'll love it !
I use Sharp cheddar cheese and shred myself. Not shredded cheese. Comes out perfect!

I liked this much more than the traditional Green Bean Casserole. The cheese is a good addition. I didn't bother with the microwave. It's not at all necessary. Just mixed it all up with 2/3 of the french fried onions. Bake for 30 mins at 350 and then top with remaining french fried onions and bake about 5 more mins to brown. 

I happened to have a LARGE (6+ lb can of green beans) that I got on a special. It's probably a perfect amount for a large Thanksgiving crowd. I drained the liquid, added 2 cans of regular cream of mushroom and 1 can of roasted garlic cream of mushroom, 2 t. salt and 1 t. pepper and 3 cups of cheddar cheese. Mixed 1- 6oz can of french fried onions into the mix and then transferred to a large casserole dish. Topped with a second can of french fried onions the last 5 mins. This would be great to make in two casserole containers and freeze one for later. I fed 10 people with it and had enough left to freeze for another meal later. I'm glad I found something everyone really liked as I have about 4 more of those LARGE cans of green beans!
First one I've ever made. Recipe was quite simple. Maybe I'll try other additives the next time just to experiment.
So good. My family loves this version with cheese. They kind of liked the original recipe but when I tried this one they were sold and I've been making it sense
Yum! My go to on Thanksgiving
Basic good
I mixed all cheese into a pot on the stove - not the microwave (bad for food). Then put in oven for about 15 minutes on 350
Husband only made instant mashed potatoes. I gave him this recipe on Mother's Day and asked him top make it. He nailed it!
Make on stovetop as is.
Jan great classic! Memphisbelle perfect modifications! Only way to make GBC! Thanks
I used french cut green beans. Delicious!
Loved this recipe!!!

Very good and easy. Will be making often. I did what some reviewers suggested and skipped the microwave and other modifications that were suggested: Stir 3 ounces of the French fried onions into the casserole along with ALL of the cheddar cheese. Bake in a flat casserole dish 30-35 minutes or until hot in the center. Then sprinkle the other 3 ounces of French fried onions over the top and bake 5 minutes more.
A hit with the WHOLE family at Christmas and made enough for all of us and some seconds!
We loved it. I gave 4 starts only because I changed it a bit. I used Asiago shredded cheese instead of cheddar. Added some real bacon bits and Worcester sauce to taste. Love love loved it.
We loved it. I gave 4 starts only because I changed it a bit. I used Asiago shredded cheese instead of cheddar. Added some real bacon bits and Worcester sauce to taste. Love love loved it.
Perfect and easy to make. My husband wants me to add mushrooms next time, but I thought it was spot on
Splash of soy sauce. I stirred the cheese into the casserole instead of putting it on top. I did not use microwave

Perfect original recipe , I only used half the cheese and mixed it in I didn’t put any on top and for the onions I used the small 2.8 since i accidentally bought the smaller one and it turned out to be the perfect amount. Mixed 3/4 onions in and the rest on top !
